did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: A.T. Mahan letter to Gen. James Wilson
did.abstract: Letter written from American naval officer and historian A.T. Mahan to Gen. James Wilson regarding the publication of Mahan's biography of Admiral James Glasgow Farragut.

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: A.T. Mahan was an American naval officer and historian. He authored the highly influential book, The Influence of Seapower Upon History.

scopecontent.head: Scope and contents
scopecontent.p: Letter written from American naval officer and historian A.T. Mahan to Gen. James Wilson regarding the publication of Mahan's biography of Farragut. Admiral David Glasgow Farragut (1801-1870), an American naval officer who served during the U.S. Civil War, is quoted as having said at the Battle of Mobile Bay, "…Damn the torpedoes … full speed ahead!"

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition information
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Robert Black, manuscripts dealer, October 17, 1968.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: A.T. Mahan letter to Gen. James Wilson, 1893, MS 182, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from the A.T. Mahan letter to Gen. James Wilson, 1893 must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

did.unittitle: Series I: A.T. Mahan letter to Gen. James Wilson, 1893
Handwritten letter, on both sides of one leaf.
